titleInfo.title: United States House Concurrent Resolution 129 (114th Congress)
United States House Concurrent Resolution 129 (114th Congress)
SUPPORTING GOAL OF ENSURING ALL HOLOCAUST VICTIMS LIVE WITH DIGNITY, COMFORT, AND SECURITY

extension.searchTitle: SUPPORTING GOAL OF ENSURING ALL HOLOCAUST VICTIMS LIVE WITH DIGNITY, COMFORT, AND SECURITY; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 89

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the concurrent resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expressing support for the goal of ensuring that all Holocaust victims live with dignity, comfort, and security in their remaining years, and urging the Federal Republic of Germany to reaffirm its commitment to this goal through a financial commitment to comprehensively address the unique health and welfare needs of vulnerable Holocaust victims, including home care and other medically prescribed needs
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Con. Res. 129, amended, expressing support for the goal of ensuring that all Holocaust victims live with dignity, comfort, and security in their remaining years, and urging the Federal Republic of Germany to reaffirm its commitment to this goal through a financial commitment to comprehensively address the unique health and welfare needs of vulnerable Holocaust victims, including home care and other medically prescribed needs, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 363 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 269;

titleInfo.title: United States House Concurrent Resolution 129 (114th Congress)
United States House Concurrent Resolution 129 (114th Congress)
CLARIFYING ELIGIBILITY OF LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCY TIME-LIMITED EMPLOYEES FOR PERMANENT APPOINTMENTS

extension.searchTitle: CLARIFYING ELIGIBILITY OF LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCY TIME-LIMITED EMPLOYEES FOR PERMANENT APPOINTMENTS; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 89

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Amending title 5, United States Code, to clarify the eligibility of employees of a land management agency in a time-limited appointment to compete for a permanent appointment at any Federal agency
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 4906, to amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify the eligibility of employees of a land management agency in a time-limited appointment to compete for a permanent appointment at any Federal agency, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 363 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 270;

titleInfo.title: MAKING ELECTRONIC GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABLE BY YIELDING TANGIBLE EFFICIENCIES ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: MAKING ELECTRONIC GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABLE BY YIELDING TANGIBLE EFFICIENCIES ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 89

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Making Electronic Government Accountable by Yielding Tangible Efficiencies Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 4904, to require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to issue a directive on the management of software licenses, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 366 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 271;

titleInfo.title: EASTERN NEVADA LAND IMPLEMENTATION IMPROVEMENT ACT

extension.searchTitle: EASTERN NEVADA LAND IMPLEMENTATION IMPROVEMENT ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 89

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Eastern Nevada Land Implementation Improvement Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 1815, amended, to facilitate certain pinyon-juniper related projects in Lincoln County, Nevada, to modify the boundaries of certain wilderness areas in the State of Nevada, and to provide for the implementation of a conservation plan for the Virgin River, Nevada, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 360 yeas to 7 nays, Roll No. 272;

titleInfo.title: NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017--Continued

extension.searchTitle: NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017--Continued; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 89

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: : Senate continued consideration of S. 2943, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McCain (for Peters) Amendment No. 4138, to provide for the treatment by discharge review boards of claims asserting post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury in connection with combat or sexual trauma as a basis for review of discharge.<P/>McCain (for Baldwin) Amendment No. 4293, to require a National Academy of Sciences study on alternative technologies for conventional munitions demilitarization.<P/>McCain (for Gillibrand) Amendment No. 4112, to expand protections against wrongful discharge to sexual assault survivors.<P/>McCain (for Schumer) Amendment No. 4177, to require a report on the replacement of the security forces and communications training facility at Frances S. Gabreski Air National Guard Base, New York.<P/>McCain (for Leahy) Amendment No. 4354, to clarify that the National Guard's mission is both Federal and non-Federal for purposes of a report on the cost of conversion of military technicians to active Guard and Reserve.<P/>McCain (for Heitkamp) Amendment No. 4079, to ensure continued operational capability for long-range bomber missions in the event of termination of the B-21 bomber program.<P/>McCain (for Hirono) Amendment No. 4317, to fulfill the commitment of the United States to the Republic of Palau.<P/>McCain (for Cardin/McCain) Amendment No. 4031, to impose sanctions with respect to foreign persons responsible for gross violations of internationally recognized human rights.<P/>McCain (for Coats) Amendment No. 4169, to require a report on the discharge by warrant officers of pilot and other flight officer positions in the Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force currently discharged by commissioned officers.<P/>McCain (for Portman/Brown) Amendment No. 4236, to require a report on priorities for bed downs, basing criteria, and special mission units for C-130J aircraft of the Air Force.<P/>McCain (for Roberts) Amendment No. 4119, to prohibit reprogramming requests of the Department of Defense for funds for the transfer or release, or construction for the transfer or release, of individuals �D614�detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.<P/>McCain (for Ernst) Amendment No. 4095, to improve Federal program and project management.<P/>McCain (for Murkowski) Amendment No. 4086, to authorize a lease of real property at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson, Alaska.<P/>McCain (for Hatch) Amendment No. 4071, to redesignate the Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition as the Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition, Technology, and Logistics.<P/>McCain (for Daines) Amendment No. 4247, to require an expedited decision with respect to securing land-based missile fields.<P/>McCain (for Sullivan) Amendment No. 4344, to authorize military-to-military exchanges with India.<P/>By 66 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 90), Durbin Amendment No. 4369, to provide that certain provisions in this Act relating to limitations, transparency, and oversight regarding medical research conducted by the Department of Defense shall have no force or effect.<P/>By 70 yeas to 28 nays (Vote No. 91), Inhofe Amendment No. 4204, to strike the provision relating to the pilot program on privatization of the Defense Commissary System.
